Portfolio

About

I am a Software Developer currently living in Frisco, Texas. I have a passion for both design and programming, and I am well-rounded in both fields.

I strive for quality in everything I do. Each project I work on is made with all my effort, and each one is made as efficently and timely as possible.

Around the Web

Copyright © Chase Vriezema 2019

Fate

Fate is a digital collectable card game that uniquely mixes multiple genres into one. It won the UTD Best Capstone 2018 Award. I spent a little less than two years designing Fate and I decided to create a full vertical slice of gameplay for my Arts and Technology capstone project. The prototype was made over the course of one semester, and I implemeneted every feature from the physical version of the game.

  • Client: UTD Capstone
  • Date: Fall 2018
  • Tools: Unity
Go to download

Mirts

Mildly Interesting RTS is an iOS game that has reached top ten on the App Store. I designed, implemented, and tested many features for the game, most of which have made it into the released version of the game. Since then I have also returned to iterate and improve on previous features in the game.

  • Date: Spring 2018
  • Tools: Rubymotion
Go to App Store

Panopticon

Panopticon is a 2D Platformer made by the graduate level game lab program at UTD. I primarily worked as an engineer on the project, and was responsible for player input, character mechanics, and the animation controller for the character. These tasks required heavy collaboration with our level designer, game designer, and our animator.

  • Client: UTD Game Lab
  • Date: Spring 2017
  • Tools: Unity
